CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, p. 1, reads: "Slain in 'Old Folks Home' - Homicide Capt. Joseph Flynn (near center, left photo) and detectives question eye-witnesses to the pistol slaying of Arizona Simms, 56 of 1824 Enoch St. (lying on floor), Monday afternoon in Hill Tavern, 1812 Wylie Ave., known as the 'Old Folks Home.'" Portions of accompanying article read: "Killer Says Victim Robbed Him Earlier.  Fifty-six-year-old Arizona Simms, of 1824 Enoch St., was fatally wounded Monday afternoon by three bullets from the gun of a man who allegedly was settling a score for being robbed of $17 by Simms a month earlier in the same Wylie Ave. tavern, according to the police.  Joseph E. ('Chef') Curd, 65, alias Lou Terry of Heldman St., has confessed the slaying at the Hill Tavern, 1812 Wylie Ave., which is known as the 'Old Folks Home,' police say...  After the tavern shooting, Curd hurried from the scene.  He was arrested at Centre and Roberts by radio patrolmen Regis Larkins and Alfred Oglesby."
TitMainTitle: Detectives examining body of Arizona Simms, with Homicide Captain Joseph Flynn questioning witnesses in background, in Hill Tavern as known as "Old Folks Home"
